treatment.description: Plants 20–90 cm. Stems coarsely scabrous. Leaves: petioles 1–5 mm; blades relatively thin, (20–)25–45 × 7–20 mm, margins entire or serrate, faces sparsely pubescent, stipitate-glandular.
treatment.habitat: Mixed woodlands, forests, igneous slopes, canyons;
treatment.discussion: Variety hinckleyi occurs in the Chisos Mountains.
